Uses of Class
de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui.ObservableComponent

  • Packages that use ObservableComponent 
    Package Description
    de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui  

    • Uses of ObservableComponent in de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui

      Subclasses of ObservableComponent in de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AttributeComponent
      a GUI component that views attributes of an object.
      class  AttributeElement
      A class for an element attribute that can be shown as a single GUI component or by the AttributeComponent.

      Three action types (AttributeElement.ActionType) are supported:
      AttributeElement.ActionType.BUTTON: a value can be set by a button.
      class  ButtonComponent
      A GUI Component to generate a button bar where you can place a JComponent in the center.
      class  ButtonElement
      A class to create a ButtonElement for the ButtonComponent.
      class  SimpleListComponent
      A GUI class which displays IListElements in a List
      Since the SimpleListComponent is an observable class, it fires a GUIEvent covered by SimpleListComponent.Commands.ELEMENT_SELECTED and with the selected element as payload.
      class  SimpleTextComponent
      a simple component for showing and editing text, based on a JTextArea.
      Since the SimpleTextComponent is an observable class, it fires a GUIEvent covered by SimpleTextComponent.Commands.TEXT_CHANGED or SimpleTextComponent.Commands.TEXT_SELECTED with payload.
      class  SlideshowComponent
      A small component to view a couple of images like a slide show

      usage:

      try {
        BufferedImage[] imgs = new BufferedImage[]{
         ImageIO.read( new File( "image_1.jpg" ) ),
         ImageIO.read( new File( "image_2.jpg" ) ),
         etc.
        };
      }
      catch( IOException e) {
         e.printStackTrace();
      }
      SlideshowComponent ssc = new SlideshowComponent( null, new Dimension( 100, 50), null );
      JFrame frm = new JFrame( "Image slide show" );
      ssc.setImages( imgs );
      // or directly: SlideshowComponent ssc = new SlideshowComponent( imgs, new Dimension( 100, 50) );
      frm.add( ssc );
      frm.setSize( 1000, 800 );
      frm.setVisible(true);

       Since the SlideshowComponent is an observable class, it fires a GUIEvent with the command text covered by SlideshowComponent.Commands.IMAGE_SELECTED and the selected image as payload.
      class  TextComponent
      a component for showing and editing styled or normal text, based on a JTextPane.
      Since the TextComponent is an observable class, it fires a GUIEvent covered by TextComponent.Commands.TEXT_CHANGED or TextComponent.Commands.TEXT_SELECTED with payload.
      Method parameters in de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui with type arguments of type ObservableComponent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HashMap<String,String> ObservableComponent.getConfigurableProperties(Class<? extends ObservableComponent> subClass)
      get the configurable properties that are provided by an enum called Properties of the extending classes
      Constructor parameters in de.dhbwka.swe.utils.gui with type arguments of type ObservableComponent 
      Constructor and Description
      ObservableComponent(String id, Class<? extends ObservableComponent> subClass, IConfigurableProperties<String>[] configurables)
      Initialize the super class ObservableComponent with configurable properties that are provided by an enum called Properties of the extending classes
